subject: Relationships

title: John Lennon and Yoko Ono
description: A micro-lesson that makes John Lennon and Yoko Ono usable.

hook.text: The world blamed her for breaking up the Beatles. He said she was the most important person in his life.

buildup.text: Lennon met Ono at her art exhibition in 1966. Their artistic and romantic partnership transformed both their careers.

discovery.text: Together they created 'Imagine,' staged bed-ins for peace, and used their fame as a platform for activism.

twist.text: Public hatred of Yoko was rooted in racism and sexism. She was blamed for a breakup that had many causes.

climax.text: Lennon and Ono proved that creative partnership in love can change culture â€” even when the world resists it.

punchline.text: Lennon called Yoko his greatest influence. The world blamed her anyway.

quiz.question: What did Lennon and Ono create together for peace?
options: Bed-ins for peace and the song 'Imagine'
